fields.Title of Presentation: “Her-story of the Naxalbari movement: Mahasweta Devi’s “Draupadi” and Joya Mitra’s Hanyaman (Killing Days: A Prison Memoir),”
fields.Description/Abstract: I chaired a special panel “Naxalite Literature: From Mahasweta Devi to Today's Student's Protests in India,” and presented an individual paper titled ““Adding Her-story of the Naxalbari movement: Mahasweta Devi’s “Draupadi” and Joya Mitra’s Hanyaman (Killing Days: A Prison Memoir).” The panel focused on India’s vernacular literatures that serve as radical archives of the Naxalbari movement. My paper focused on two literary texts “Draupadi” and Hanyaman to analyze the literary methods of adding gender as a category for analysis of the history of the Naxalbari movement.
